game

Interface GameObject

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Drawable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Enemy, Hero

    public interface GameObject
extends Drawable
    This Interface represents the GameObject object. It combines the lot of Drawable and methods commonly used by games. It also makes the Objects moveable and damagable.
    Since:
    16-8-2014
    Version:
    16-8-2014
    Author:
    stefanboodt
    See Also:
    Drawable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void die()
      Method that should be called when the GameObject died.
      int getRemainingHits()
      Gets the hits that must be done to kill the GameObject.
      void hit(GameObject hitter)
      Makes the GameObject hit.
      void move(float dx, float dy)
      Moves the GameObject by dx and dy.

      • Methods inherited from interface interfaces.Drawable

        draw, turnOnAntiAliasing

    • Method Detail

      • move

        void move(float dx,
          float dy)
        Moves the GameObject by dx and dy.
        Parameters:
        dx - The horizontal distance.
        dy - The vertical distance.

      • hit

        void hit(GameObject hitter)
        Makes the GameObject hit. All subclasses should implement what happens if the object is hit by the given hitter.
        Parameters:
        hitter - The Object that hit this one.

      • die

        void die()
        Method that should be called when the GameObject died.

      • getRemainingHits

        int getRemainingHits()
        Gets the hits that must be done to kill the GameObject.
        Returns:
        The number of hits remaining.
